Description: Wooden box inlaid with ivory panels on the walls and truncated pyramidal lid; on one side the panels are decorated with representations of birds and mythological(?) figures in red and black paint, on the top of the lid and the other three sides the panels(some missing) are decorated with incised representations of similar figures; the lid is also inlaid with lengths of ivory beading; the interior is lined with textile.
Curator's comments: Cf. Baltimore, Walters Art Museum, inv. 71.40 [Brooklyn 1941, no. 97; Paris 1931 (Exposition d'art byzantine), no. 12; Art News, 4 Mar 1939, 10]. Cf. For central plaque comparison: Hamm 1996 no.196 pg. 197. Cf. For dated comparison of artistic style on plaques: Rodziewicz 2011, fig. 29 & p.65. Cf. For beading/bands comparison and general caskets notes: Rodziewicz 2007 pp.33-34, pls. 28-31 & 105, Catalogue numbers 104-109, pp.112-114. Cf. For central putto flanked by birds and artistic style comparison: Marseille 1997 no.105, p. 104
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: SM (written in white on top)
